title: Comtrade Digital services
segmentation: So country digital Services is part of Country Group which is the largest IT company in the Adriatic region.
It is.
So provider of strategic software engineering services and solutions.
We are focused on basically helping enterprises change their business model with innovative software.
So let me tell you about some of our focuses, so one vertical is medical technology.
Then smart energy.
Something tech services and last but not least, implementation of AI systems, which is the business unit that I lead.
So our main target markets are.
Doc Region, Ireland and UK and United States.
So our kind of philosophy is to try to basically compete in most demanding markets becausw when we doing in such markets the results are really worth it.
So here are some of our clients, most of them large enterprises, although we also work with some small and medium companies, especially startups who have reached the growth phase.
So while we do have a strong internal AI team, our basic way of work is to form partnerships becausw everything related to artificial intelligence.
The field has really become very wide and when we work with our clients we want to build teams that basically include people who are really true experts in their niche field.
So yeah, I collective is a partnership between academic institutions, so University universities and research institutes, but also a number of specialized startups.
So.
I'm telling you about the AI collective becausw.
I really like to encourage.
You basically who are interested in cooperating with us to approach me so we could discuss some partnership.
We are especially interested in companies who do work with computer vision or natural language processing as well as some who are more hardware oriented.
For example, companies focused on doing edge computing.
Or maybe even some hardware manufacturers.
So.
With with AI today it is that we.
I think we have really reached a phase where it is very important to consider ethical implications of our work.
So, when deciding which opportunity to follow, we always also consider this as an important aspect.
So I will present some use cases today that while of course are commercially oriented also.
Have other benefits for for a wider SoC, so the first one is something that we did with our UX client stem.
This is a company that is provider of energy storage as a surface so they have more than 900 storage systems for over 280 organizations across USA, Canada and Japan.
So what they basically do is that they build very very large batteries like houses, size batteries.
And then they enable their customers who are usually manufacturing companies to operate normally for hours at a time.
Their entire entire factory on battery power.
So Stan, his expanded into Canadian market, namely Ontario region and this region is very specific in terms of the challenges that they face with their energy system energy grid.
So due to some their decisions that they have made in the past, they are facing very large costs of maintaining this system.
So therefore the regulator has decided to put.
Very large penalties on companies which are basically using electricity during peak during peak hours where the grid is most vulnerable.

So basically what was the problem at hand is that we've had to build predictive analytics machine learning based systems to predict the peak hours where the electricity demand will be highest sometime in advance.
So not only to catch the exact hour each day where the demand will be highest, but also whether this hour will be one of five.
Hours in the entire year where the demand will be highest.
So the system that they have is that basically you use the electricity for a year and then next year they look at whether you have reached the maximum.
Whether you have used a lot of electricity during those five hours.
So the system that that we built was based on classical machine learning methods, decision tree based methods.
Although we did also use some auto email neural networks based solutions.
Ann got to the result that basically using automized machine learning we were able to achieve the same or slightly even slightly better performance and then just by doing the usual.
Manual kind of creation of models.
And also the solution was interesting also from the data engineering point of view, because it had to be closely incorporated into our client system.
So everything was based on Kubernetes, everything was dockerized.
We build various services.
And in the end we achieved quite good results.
And the system is now in production for some time.
So I want to talk also about another use case which is from a totally different area and that is an analysis of microscopic images.
This is a project that is currently ongoing and it is a good example of a project that really benefits from deep learning methodology.
So the problem at hand here is that.

Microscopic images, for example, such as the one on the left are this is images of basically blood images and for diagnostic purposes it is often necessary to estimate the number of individual cell nuclei and also the diameter of cells.
And to do this manually it's really very time consuming process so.
What we did was basically build in kind of an instance segmentation model that is able to create masks of individual cells.
And also separate between the two individual cells.
And so this was built using the mask R CNN network and basically get also quite nice results.
You see how it looks like on the on the image on the right.
And basically this is part of a project that aims at automating this micro microscopic image analysis by putting it to the cloud.
So basically the people who collect the samples with only.
Upload the images and get results immediately.
So can trade is also involved in some research activities, for example with the European Organization for Nuclear Research and some European projects.
So, but thank you for.
Retention.
